Go ahead and do your thing with the Palette!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.083:
Hey, um...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]have you thought about...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]NOT fighting us
next time? Maybe?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.084:
Don't be siwwy! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]If I let you weconfigure ALL the
Palettes, then I'd...
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.085: Don't leave us hanging. You'd what?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.086:
Bleaaahhh! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Forget it! You won't get me to give up
that easiwy!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.091: Whew. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]One more reconfigured Palette on the books!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.092: So...um...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]are you leaving so soon?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.093:
Easy there. That wasn't the last Palette we need to
reconfigure. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]You'll see us again.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.094:
You better hope not! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]I'll definitewy win next time![group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
I can't wait to[group=0004 type=0005 params=]...
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.095: [size=150%]NEVER MIND! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]FORGET IT AND GO![size=100%]
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.101:
Aaand that should do it! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Congrats, Eight! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]We finally
reconfigured your Palette.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.103:
So that's it, huh? [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]You meanies beat...[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]I mean,
you folks beat me fair and square.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.104:
You know it's gotten real when even Smollusk is
throwing in the towel.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.105:
The Memverse is gonna be a place to save Octolings.[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]
Just like Mawina wanted.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.106:
So much for the dweams of evewyone who wanted
a place for order...
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.107:
But hey! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Sticking awound as the "big boss" of the
Spire won't be so bad.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.109:
I always got a wittle thwilled when you'd come up
here again and again.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.110: I hope your lives go good in the weal world! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Pwease?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.111:
And, um...[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]if you wanna make me smile sometimes...
come back to pway with me?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.301: Grrrrrrrr! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]You're pwetty tough customers.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.302: Look who's talking...[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00] That could've gone way worse!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.303: HAWWOOMFF! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]I won't wose next time!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.311: Awww. I thought things would go diffwent that time.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.312: Score one for the good guys!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.313:
Gwaaah! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Next time, you'll be sowwy! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Now get out
of here, you dum-dums! PPPBBBTTT!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.321:
Huff...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]puff...[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]phew. You won't find me so easy next
time, I pwomise.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.322:
Isn't that a stock phrase for small-time villains? [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]I bet
I know exactly where you get your material.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.323:
HEY! No metacommentawy, pwease! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Now take a hike,
you meanies!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.501: Wow! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]You and Peawl are super tough, Eight!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.503:
That was fun. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Pwease come and pway with me
again sometime!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.511: Gweat job! You fought wike you meant it!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.512:
You too, Smollusk! I'm so proud of you. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]I hope you'll
stay on as the Spire's final boss!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.513:
I will! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]I'm excited to meet all the Octolings who are
gonna come chawwenge me. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]And I hope you folks
won't be stwangers, OK? Pwease?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.521:
That was incwedible, Eight! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]You were way too fast and
stwong for me.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.522:
Don't sell yourself short, Smollusk. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]You're no slouch
either. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Sorry if we interrupted you on break.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_D140.523:
I told you, I NEVER slack off! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Next time, you'll face
a Smollusk with NO BWAKES!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_ElevatorFirst.000: Alright! Hit the button for the top floor already!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_ElevatorFirst.001:
Love to, [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]but this elevator only goes up one [color=0004]floor
at a time[color=ffff].
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_ElevatorFirst.002: Whaaat?! How come?! You mean I gotta be PATIENT?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_ElevatorFirst.003:
I'm in a hurry myself. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]But we play what we're dealt.
We'll just have to take this a little at a time.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_ElevatorFirst.004:
Now then. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]We're almost at the next floor. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Are you
two ready?

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_EvilEventFirst.000: Huh? [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Something funky's up with the next floor.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_EvilEventFirst.001:
Yeah, there's [color=0004]danger[color=ffff] there. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Whatever happens on a
floor like that, you're not going to like.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_EvilEventFirst.002: No kidding? [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Well, we know what not to pick!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_EvilEventFirst.003:
The thing is...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]if you don't, Danger floors will show
up more and more often until you go for one.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_EvilEventFirst.004:
Seriously?! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Maybe we oughta bite the bullet. Don't
want to be faced with three bad options later.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_EvilEventFirst.005:
Might as well. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]If it's too much, you can always spend
some [group=0003 type=003f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]Membux to return to the elevator.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_EvilEventFirst.006: True. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]I dunno, Eight. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]I'll leave it up to you!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_HackingIntroduction.000: Hey, Eight, do you have a sec?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_HackingIntroduction.001:
I've been running some scans. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Somehow, Order jacked
up the threat level in the Spire as high as it'll go.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_HackingIntroduction.002:
Why's it gotta go and do that? [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]And what does it
mean for us?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_HackingIntroduction.003:
Well, for one thing, the Spire's suddenly taller.[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
But that's not the worst part.[page break]Run out of Lives even once, and you'll get [color=0004]kicked out
of the Spire[color=ffff]. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]And that'll probably happen, since [color=0004]enemies
hurt more[color=ffff].
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_HackingIntroduction.004: OK, yeah, I'm seeing some challenges here.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_HackingIntroduction.005:
That said...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]I built the Memverse to begin with. I don't
have to take this sitting down.[page break]Now that I'm outside the Spire, I can [color=0004]hack [color=ffff]the system,
overwrite the changes, and lower the difficulty!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_HackingIntroduction.006:
Whoa, you can do all that?! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Glad to have you back on
OUR side!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_HackingIntroduction.007: Thing is, I'll need [color=0004][group=0003 type=0040 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]Prlz[color=ffff] to get any hacking done.[page break]But you should have some Prlz already, I think.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_HackingIntroduction.008:
There you go! Those Prlz were generated when you
came out of the Spire.[page break]Every time you leave, your [color=0004][group=0003 type=0037 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]color chips [color=ffff]and
[color=0004][group=0003 type=003f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]Membux [color=ffff]will automatically be [color=0004]converted into Prlz[color=ffff].
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_HackingIntroduction.009:
So like...we're probably gonna bite it in the Spire, but if
we kick some butt first, we get more Prlz?[page break]And giving Prlz to Marina for hacks to [color=0004]make it easier[color=ffff]
will help us next time. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Even losing helps us win!
I like this plan!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_HackingIntroduction.010:
Here are the settings I've figured out how to hack
so far. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Want me to fix anything in your favor?

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator1F.000: I knew Eight had it in the bag!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator1F.001:
Yeah, that was solid work. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]You're learning to make the
most of your color chips.[page break]There are different kinds of color chips. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]You get one
[color=0004]every time you head to a new floor[color=ffff].[page break]Here—I'll show you.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator1F.002:
What you're seeing is [color=0004]the next floor[color=ffff] and details on
[color=0004]the color chip you'll get [color=ffff]there.[page break]That color chip is...[color=0004][group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Poison Ink[color=ffff]. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]I'd tell you what it
does, but it's all written there already.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator1F.003: It's cool. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]No teacher like experience! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Am I right, Eight?!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator2F.000:
You two are handling this like pros. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Maybe you do have
what it takes to reach the top.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator2F.001:
I was gonna ask about that. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]How come you know so
much about this place, Acht?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator2F.002:
Fair question. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Everything I'm telling you, I'm pulling
from the elevator console.[page break]I learned the trick from the same place Marina did.[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
Though I won't blame you for being skeptical.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator2F.003:
For real?! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]I guess it's true that Marina's a turbo
nerd when it comes to machines.[page break]If you went to the same school, I'm not surprised
you can do the same stuff.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator2F.004:
Well...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]she was a few ranks above me. I wouldn't put
myself quite in her league.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator2F.005: By the way, here's your next color chip.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator2F.007:
These [color=0004][group=0003 type=0045 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]Lucky Bombs[color=ffff] appear when you defeat
enemies. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]They explode on their own for big damage.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator2F.008:
Sounds great. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]I'm always wishing a bomb would show
up to blow away anyone harassing me!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator3F.000:
Good hustle, Eight. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]I've got the lowdown on the next
floor for you.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator3F.001:
Whoa! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]We get TWO color chips from this one?![group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
Twoice as noice!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator3F.002:
Hey, I've been wondering. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]It says [group=0003 type=003f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00][color=0004]Reward [color=ffff]there.
What's that about?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator3F.003:
It's how much [group=0003 type=003f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00][color=0004]Membux[color=ffff] you get from clearing the
floor. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Not sure what those are for yet, but they seem
like a good thing to have.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator3F.004: Well, if you say so. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Table that for now, I guess.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator3F.005:
Eight, when you [color=0004]need a break[color=ffff] from climbing the tower,
press [group=0003 type=004a params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] to let me know.[page break]I'll stop the elevator and wait here until you're ready.[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]
No sense pushing yourself past your limits.

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator4F.000: Awww yeah! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]We're on a roll!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator4F.001:
Y'know, this drone body's not so bad if it means
Eight doesn't have to do all the work.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator4F.002:
This next color chip will help with that too. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Use it
right, and you'll be a powerful ally to Eight.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator4F.003: It lets me use [color=0004]Killer Wail[color=ffff]?! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]NOW we're talking!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator5F.000: We're at about the halfway point.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator5F.001:
Cool. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Can't believe all this is going down in the middle
of our big world tour.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator5F.002:
On tour, are you? [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]That tracks. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]You're some kind
of musician, I take it?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator5F.003:
Yeah! Marina and I are [color=0004]Off the Hook[color=ffff], the world's
most powerful power team!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator5F.004: Huh. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]So Marina hit it big as an artist, did she?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator5F.006: Marina?! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Hang on, girl! We're on our way!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator5F.007: I did NOT like the sound of that. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Let's pick up the pace!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator6F.000:
We're on FIRE! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Let's keep it moving, and don't stop
till we hit the top!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator6F.002:
The next floor lets you choose your own objective.[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
You get a different color chip for each one.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator6F.003:
Different difficulties too. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Well, you're the one with
legs, Eight. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Which way are we going?

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator7F.000: No sign of Marina on this floor either.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator7F.001:
I hope she's doing alright. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]She's seemed a little
burned out lately.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator7F.002:
I guess we've still got a world tour to finish...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]but after
that, I promised her we could find a quiet spot together
and take it easy for a while. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]So we gotta save her, fast!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator7F.003:
Sounds like Marina met the right people after she
got free. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]But this is Marina we're talking about,[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]
so I expected as much.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator7F.004:
Well, y'know what they say...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]no one knows you like the
folks you grew up with.[page break]Plus, Marina had to learn the language when she got
to Greater Inkopolis, so you gotta figure she struggled
at least a LITTLE.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator7F.005:
I'd love to sit down and swap Marina stories, but this
ain't the time! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Every second we spend chewing the fat
is a second we're not finding her!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator8F.000:
We're up pretty high now, huh? [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Bet we're racking up
the color chips.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator8F.001:
See for yourself. You can press [group=0003 type=0048 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] to check
your Palette.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator8F.002:
One, [group=0001 type=0000 params=05 00 00 00]two, [group=0001 type=0000 params=05 00 00 00]three...[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00] Wow, we got a bunch![page break]Yo...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]what's up with the "Range" and "Power" stuff
over on the left?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator8F.003:
Those are the color-chip [color=0004]tones[color=ffff].[page break]Color chips come in tones based on their effects.[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
Each tone has its own color and pattern.[page break]Reddish [group=0003 type=0037 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]color chips are in the [color=0004]Power [color=ffff]tone, [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]so they
mostly up your damage output.[page break]A once-over at your Palette will show you which color
chips you're heavy on. Should give you an idea of where
your strengths lie.[page break]And if you're done checking your Palette...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]it's time to
move on to the next floor.

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator9F.000: Heads up. We're coming to the top floor.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator9F.001: That's where we'll find Marina, right?!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator9F.002:
Probably. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Though something about it seems...different
from the floors up to now.[page break]Eight. Pearl. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Watch yourselves.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator9F.003: What's this, Eight? [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Are they wooorried about us?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator9F.005: Nah. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]You just sound like Marina when you say that.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Elevator9F.006:
But enough messing around! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Let's go find Marina.[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
No holding back, Eight—this is it!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1EntranceFirst.000:
Is this for real? [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Wherever we are, it's nothing like
the Inkopolis Square tower.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1EntranceFirst.001: I'm getting the heebie-jeebies. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Keep your eyes open!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage1F.000:
We're up to [color=0004]1F[color=ffff]. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]It's the floor right above the foyer.[page break]Each floor has an [color=0004]objective[color=ffff] you need to clear. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Take care
of that, and you can go up another floor.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage1F.001: Your objective here is to destroy that [color=0004][group=0003 type=003d params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]portal[color=ffff].
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage1F.002:
Also. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]The thing you set into your [group=0003 type=0038 params=cd cc 8c 3f 02 00 00 00]Palette is a
[color=0004]Main Damage (Distant)[color=ffff] color chip.[page break]Now that you've set it, [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]your [group=0003 type=0050 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] shots will do more
damage [color=0004]from a distance[color=ffff].
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage1F.003:
There's a practice target right there. See for yourself
how your shots do up close and at range.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage1F.004:
Well, Eight? [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]You wanna science it out or jump right
into the mix?

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage2F.000: I count [color=0004]3 [color=ffff][group=0003 type=003d params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]portals this time.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage2F.001: Same drill as before, right? No probs!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage2F.002:
The Poison Ink color chip is nice. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Says here [color=0001][color=0004]enemies[color=0001]
[color=0004]take more damage while in your ink[color=0001][color=ffff].
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage2F.003:
Oh, word? I wanna see! Shoot some ink around the
base of that target there.

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage3F.000:
Hey, you said Lucky Bombs explode on their own?[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
Isn't that, uh, kinda dangerous for Eight?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage3F.001:
Nah. It shouldn't hurt either of you, just them.[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
Why, you worried?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage3F.002:
Hey, I believe in Eight! Just asking questions, y'know.[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
If you say it's safe, then bombs away!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage3F.004:
Looks from here like a [color=0004]canned special[color=ffff]. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Grabbing one
will fill half your special gauge.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage3F.005:
You use specials by pressing in the Right Stick ([group=0003 type=004c params=ec 51 38 3f fe ff ff ff]),
remember? [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]If you get mobbed, blast out with
your Reefslider!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage4F.000: What gives? [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]I'm not seeing any portals.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage4F.001:
Different objective. This time, you need to ink that
[color=0004][group=0003 type=0039 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]zone [color=ffff]and guard it until time's up.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage4F.003:
Yep. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]But I don't see a way to get to the high ground
with the zone. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]The wall by it looks inkproof.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage4F.004:
Probably just need to [color=0004]glide[color=ffff] from somewhere high up.[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
That's where I come in!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage4F.005:
Eight, if you ever wanna slow your fall, press [group=0003 type=0047 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
while in midair to hang on to me.[page break]You can move while hanging on to land a good distance
away. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Though it'll only work in [color=0004]Octoling form[color=ffff]!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage5F.000:
New floor! Time to bust out the ol' Killer Wail![group=0001 type=0000 params=3c 00 00 00]
Uh...what? [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]More like Killer FAIL!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage5F.001:
Pearl...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]you can't use your drone features until the
[color=0004]drone gauge[color=ffff] is full.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage5F.002:
No kidding? Fine...[page break]Guess the drone gauge fills on its own after a while.[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
Once it's full, look out, world!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage5F.003:
Actually, you don't even need to wait. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Pick up that
[color=0004][group=0003 type=0044 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]drone battery[color=ffff], and it'll fill some drone gauge.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage5F.004:
Now then. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Your objective here is to get that
[color=0004][group=0003 type=003a params=cd cc 8c 3f 04 00 00 00]turbine tower[color=ffff] to the goal.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage5F.005:
A turbine tower, huh? [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Fastest way I know to make
things happen is to shoot 'em!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage6F.000: Hold up! [group=0001 type=0000 params=05 00 00 00]There are TWO [group=0003 type=0039 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00][color=0004]zones [color=ffff]this time?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage6F.001: You'll just have to secure them both.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage6F.002:
I see [color=0004][group=0003 type=0043 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]disc pieces[color=ffff] for the drone way back there.[page break]Put three of them together, and you can give the
enemy a taste of the [color=0004]Step-Off Song[color=ffff].
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage6F.003:
I don't know what that does, but I like the sound of it![group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
Let's snag them if we can, Eight!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage6F.004:
We got two [color=0004]Main Range[color=ffff] color chips this time, right?[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
That oughta help us keep 'em off our turf!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage7F.000: Huh? [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Check me on this, but are those new enemies?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage7F.001:
They're [group=0003 type=003c params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]Jelletons, just like the rest. You only have
to beat three to clear the floor.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage7F.002:
Yo, do they got WHEELS for feet?! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Won't that make
'em hard to catch?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage7F.003:
Well, whatever. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]You can take pretty much anything,
Eight. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]We've got this!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage8F.000: The color chip this time is [color=0004]Max Lucky Chain[color=ffff].
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage8F.001: You wanna explain what a [color=0004]Lucky Chain[color=ffff] is?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage8F.002:
Beating two enemies right after each other starts
a [color=0004]Lucky Chain[color=ffff].[page break]The higher your Lucky Chain goes, [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]the more likely
it is that you'll see items or [group=0003 type=0045 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]Lucky Bombs.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage8F.003:
So basically...we wanna go on a splatting spree.
Hah! We were gonna do that anyway!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage9F.000: Aw man! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Not THOSE things again!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage9F.001:
'Fraid so. You're going to have to get the [color=0004][group=0003 type=003b params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]∞-balls[color=ffff]
over to the goals.[page break]There's good news though. The ∞-balls won't ever
fall off the stage, [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]so knock them around as much as
you need.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage9F.002: Yesss! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Hear that, Eight? You don't need to hold back!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage9F.003:
The new color chip is [color=0004]Dodge Roll Attack[color=ffff], [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]which puts a
little bite in your dualies' Dodge Roll.[page break]If you really want, you could push the ∞-balls
around using only those.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1Stage9F.004:
In case you forgot, you do Dodge Rolls by tilting [group=0003 type=004b params=ec 51 38 3f fe ff ff ff]
and pressing [group=0003 type=0047 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] while you're shooting ink! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Give it
a whirl by Dodge Rolling over to that target.

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1WorldTowerSound.001: Marina?![group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00] Are you up there?!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1WorldTowerSound.003: Hang on! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]We're coming up to you now!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase1WorldTowerSound.004: Shake a leg, Eight! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Marina's [color=0004]at the top of the tower[color=ffff]!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase2EntranceFirst.000: Whoa! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Even the foyer looks different now.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase2EntranceFirst.001:
There's a bunch more stuff in here. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]May as well
practice on it before going up the Spire.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase2EntranceFirst.002:
Oh, and did Marina say something about Palettes?[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]
Like, you [color=0004]can't change 'em while in the Spire[color=ffff]?[page break]We better be cool with what we got before boarding
the elevator, huh. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Check your Palette with [group=0003 type=004a params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase2PreStoryBoss.000: Useless. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Try all you like. The result will never change.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase2PreStoryBoss.001: Hey...[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]the [color=0004]Palette's empty[color=ffff]! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Did Order do this?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase2PreStoryBoss.002:
Look! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]I think I see [group=0003 type=0037 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00][color=0004]color chips [color=ffff]trapped[color=0004] inside
those[color=ffff][color=0001] [color=ffff][color=0004]portals[color=ffff].
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase2PreStoryBoss.003:
Awww yeah! We're turning up the intensity on this
fight! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]It's encore time...[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00] Ready to take a bow, Eight?

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase2WorldFirst.001: Niiice. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Don't worry, Eight—I got your back.[page break]Let's get this show on the road!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase3EntranceFirst.000:
Oh, Eight? [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Remember that the Palette you used to
knock out Order has already been reconfigured.[page break]So...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]what do you think about using a different Palette
this time? [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]You can switch it up with [group=0003 type=004a params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase3WorldFirst.000: Yo, I think someone's set up shop behind the lockers.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Phase3WorldFirst.001:
Let's go hit the lockers and then check out whoever
it is while we're out there!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Plaza_Intro.000:
Welcome to Inkopolis Square, the new [color=0001]nerve
center [color=ffff]of Inkling culture.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Plaza_Intro.001:
That's [color=0001]Deca Tower[color=ffff] there in front of you!
One of the tallest buildings in all of Inkopolis![page break]There's a [color=0001]lobby[color=ffff] on the first floor of Deca Tower
for online battles!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Plaza_Intro.002:
Over here, we've got the [color=0001]Galleria[color=ffff], Inkopolis's
most popular shopping center.[page break]Here you can buy the freshest [color=0001]gear[color=ffff] and
[color=0001]weapons [color=ffff]to use in battle.[page break]But the shops are pretty exclusive, and they
won't serve you if you're not fresh enough!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Plaza_Intro.003:
Uh...what else? Oh, that creepy shop back there.
Rumor has it they're hiring for some sketchy job.[page break]Might wanna think twice before you apply
there...unless you really need dough.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Plaza_Intro.004:
That brings us to the [color=0001]Shoal[color=ffff], the coolest
hangout spot in all of Inkopolis![page break]It's where Inklings and Octolings meet up with
nearby friends for competitive and co-op play.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Plaza_Intro.005:
If you want to visit another city, you can hit
up the [color=0001]train station[color=ffff] here.[page break]Looks like a few residents are still spacing out...
Shouldn't someone do something about that?[page break]One of the destinations from the train is the
[color=0001]Order Sector[color=ffff]. Be sure to check it out!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_Plaza_Intro.006:
And that's it! Feel free to give yourself a tour
or dive straight into the strange phenomenon![page break]Whatever you choose, enjoy Inkopolis Square!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PostBattleTutorial.000: Whew! [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]I think that was the last of 'em.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PostBattleTutorial.001:
Huh? [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Where'd I get the weapon from? [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Iunno.
Your guess is as good as mine.[page break]Just felt like...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]something I had in me, y'know?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PostBattleTutorial.002: But never mind that. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]The [color=0004]elevator[color=ffff]'s running again!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PostBattleTutorial.003:
We can sit and scratch our heads all we want,[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]
but why bother when the answers are up there?
Let's get moving, Eight!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PostHackingIntroducti.000:
Even you'd have a hard time getting to the new top of
the Spire, Eight. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]But my hacks should smooth the way.[page break]That's the best I can do from here. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]It'll be up to you to
put a stop to Order!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PostHackingIntroducti.001: One more thing.[page break]Here, Eight. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]I have a [color=0004][group=0003 type=0038 params=cd cc 8c 3f 02 00 00 00]Palette [color=ffff]for you.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PostHackingIntroducti.002:
One of those things color chips go into? [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Didn't know you
had your own.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PostHackingIntroducti.005:
Setting this Palette to your drone—I mean,[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00] Pearl—will
let you use a [color=0004]new weapon[color=ffff].[page break]I did some research, and this doesn't seem to be the
only other Palette in the Memverse.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PostHackingIntroducti.008:
My early scans of those [color=0004]lockers[color=ffff] over there show signs
of other Palettes inside.[page break]When you saved me, I found myself with some [group=0003 type=003e params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00][color=0004]keys[color=ffff]
for those lockers. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]You should have them, Eight.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PostHackingIntroducti.009:
Oh, but you [color=0004]can't change Palettes while climbing the
Spire[color=ffff]. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]If you want to switch, make sure to press [group=0003 type=004a params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
before getting in the elevator.

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PostStaffRoll.000:
Maybe I got a wittle cawwied away back there. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]But this
isn't over yet![page break]They still want their coworwess world of order. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]And I'm
gonna give it to them!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PreBattleTutorial.001: Trouble's coming for us. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Use these!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_PreBattleTutorial.002:
You remember your way around a weapon, right?[group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]
Press [group=0003 type=0050 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] to show 'em who they're dealing with!

EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_ShopFirst.000: Oooh. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]Check it out, Eight!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_ShopFirst.001:
"[color=0004]Vending-Machine Corner[color=ffff]"! [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]Wanna get a soda and kick
back for a bit?
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_ShopFirst.002:
Oh...[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]these don't sell drinks. But for a few [group=0003 type=003f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]Membux,
you can restock [color=0004]Lives[color=ffff] or buy [color=0004]color chips[color=ffff].[page break]Some even let you swap your [color=0004]sub weapon [color=ffff]or [color=0004]special
weapon[color=ffff] for a new one!
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_ShopFirst.003:
Also, a Vending-Machine Corner counts as a floor. [group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]So if
you hit one up, that's one less risk you take on your
way up the Spire.
EventFlowMsg/Sdodr_ShopFirst.004:
Solid arguments all around. [group=0001 type=0000 params=1e 00 00 00]So whaddaya say, Eight?[group=0001 type=0000 params=0f 00 00 00]
Wanna see what it's got?

LayoutMsg/Coop_Shop_00.300:
You're such a dear. Thank you. By the
way, it seems we just got some new
items in stock. Have a gander!
LayoutMsg/Coop_Shop_00.301:
Dearie me! Quite the spender, aren't
you? And here's little ol' me with a
fresh stock of rare items to sell.
What ever shall I do?

LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.001:
Greater Inkopolis and the Splatlands have wildly different methods of
serving up clam mochi. "Inkopolis style" means a clam wrapped in mochi,
but Splatlanders wrap the mochi with clams! They also sprinkle on sesame
seeds and top it with hot sauce. Mmm... It's Splatsville's clam to fame!
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.002:
"Long ago, our splatted lands were almost washed away by a great flood.
All was presumed lost...until three lights appeared and united to consume
the disaster. Thankful for their salvation, the townsfolk threw a festival
with three portable shrines as a tribute."
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.003:
"Visit a sparkling city of chaos."
"The hottest place in the Splatlands!"
"Anarchy Avenue. Walk it. Feel it. Live it."
—Special Collection, "Walk the Splatsville Walk," pg. 54
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.004:
"Live wild! Live free! We do whatever we want!
This town is a melting pot, so let's stir things up!"
"I'm tired of folks pretending to be cool.
I wanna get so fired up that I boil over!"
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.005:
For the Inklings and Octolings of the Splatlands, aggressive action
is the best way to make a splash in the local scene. Youths will often
dress themselves in the style of a delinquent or hooligan to intimidate
peers during combative courtship rituals known as "rumbles."
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.006:
"The lobby I've built doesn't have a single standout feature...'cause
EVERYTHING in there is featureworthy! If you don't have the greatest
Turf War experience ever, I'll eat the smaller of my two claws."
—Glen Fiddler, President & CEO
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.007:
Grizzco Industries Occupational-Safety Guidelines
(1) Keep your eggs in the game. (2) "I'll try to grab one more!"
could end with one less—of YOU! (3) Sea goes dark, tide goes up.
(4) ACB: Always Check the Basket. (5) Throw eggs! Don't yolk around!
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.008:
Salmonids mature by returning to the waters where they were spawned.
Sometimes, in very rare cases, a young Salmonid will stray too far from
their original school during a run and become lost. Their wandering quest
to return home can lead to prolonged starvation and an insatiable appetite.
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.009:
"Splatsville's rowdiest, loud-iest trio is hijacking the airwaves!
Clean out those ears and open those eyes wide for your hometown
hype squad, Deep Cut! Tune in and catch 'em—if you can!"
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.010:
"A hungry blade, a sharp grin in a wild warrior's hand.
It bites just once—a flash, a slash, a sudden shudder.
Shredded remains sink down, down, down like falling snow.
A fleeting flurry, brief as life itself, falls around my open parasol."
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.011:
"Moray Eel Manipulation: Secret Dances of the Onaga Clan
First: Soak the dry ground like a welcome summer rainstorm.
Second: Stir up a whirlpool to summon winds from the rocky shore.
Final: As a hundred eels take flight, follow them to the promised land."
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.012:
The Manta Clan's Early-Morning Ritual
After careful grooming of their pectoral fins, the family gathers for their
favorite breakfast. This unique plankton dish, a family recipe passed down
across generations, is said to enhance the mind, body, and bodily toxins.
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.013:
"One year after expanding his business into a new region."
"Bombarding the Splatlands with over 20,000 hours of rapid-fire
weapons chatter! His steel scopes are aimed at a new horizon."
"What's next for the so-called arsenal ambassador?"
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.015:
"Man-o'-Wardrobe" "We are temporarily closed so that we may restock."
"Cash only" "No photography or influencers allowed. Ever." "We've run
rather low on paper bills." "We're always open. Your fashion emergency
is our fashion emergency." "Do NOT touch it until you have PAID for it."
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.016:
As they grow, crustaceans such as the coconut crab frequently shed their
shells to allow for further growth. Because strong sunlight encourages
this shedding behavior, this may explain why Splatlands crustaceans often
grow to be far larger than their counterparts in other regions.
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.017:
"YO! Barry C. here, Hotlantis's hottest (only) owner, ha! I gotta split for
a bit to stock up on...stock. （・ω<） But it's all good! Harmony (yup, from
Chirpy Chips) is fillin' in, and she knows this shop way, WAY better than
me. (;^_^A So business? That's gonna keep right on boomin'! （＾ｖ＾）v"
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.018:
"Fryin' out here in Scorch Gorge—in more ways than one!
#SweatyShell #BikingTrip"
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.019:
"Letter of Appointment
Employment: New Squidbeak HQ, First Splatoon
Adjustments: Promoted to Captain with emoluments of pay grade 33.
–Craig Cuttlefish"
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.020:
"Thursday night / Friday morning at 1:00 AM: It's the 100th episode of
Marie After Midnight, and a special guest stopped by to help me celebrate:
my cousin Callie! It's a Squid Sisters gabfest! We could NOT stop talking.
(Not kidding. We went over the scheduled end time by five hours. Oops.)"
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.021:
Seems these are instructions on how to mummify an Inkling. Maybe in
olden times, Inklings thought if they preserved their bodies after death,
they could be revived someday? But that's... Well, there's no way this is
a real one stuck here, right? No, of course it isn't... Right?
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.022:
After leaping from Inkopolis Square to the world stage, Off the Hook has
found their new side project: performing vocals for a rising rock band as
Damp Socks feat. Off the Hook! Discovered online, their super-talented
collaborators offer an "upbeat melancholy" sound that had OTH...hooked!
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.023:
"Operation: Li'l Judd's Judgy Judgment!" "Prey's behavior"
"Analyzing prey's fur quality... No impurrrfections found!"
"I guess I'll just go after the toe beans."
LayoutMsg/Msn_MysteryFile_00.024:
"Subject name: 'Marigold'
Nishiyo Oranda (Alias): Anarchy District 3, 3-■
Poisson Rouge (Alias): Rue de ■■ 19-6, Chateaubateau
Ran Chi-Yu (Alias): Southgill Province, Tailfin City, ■■■ District"

LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_00_00_Center:
[group=0003 type=002d params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]The Final Fest is over.[group=0003 type=002d params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

And we lost. I feel so bad for Team
[color=0003]Order[color=ffff]... They all tried so hard! [group=0003 type=0032 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_00_01_Center:
BUT! At the end of the Splatfest, Pearl
said we're gonna "[color=0002]TAKE OVER THE
WORLD![color=ffff]" [group=0003 type=002f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] A world tour! Can you
believe it?! [group=0003 type=0035 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] I can't wait! [group=0003 type=0030 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

I haven't felt like this since I was on
the sidelines for [color=0003]that battle[color=ffff]. Right
before I came to [color=0003]Inkopolis Square[color=ffff]!

If [color=0003]Off the Hook[color=ffff]'s going on a world tour,
my schedule's about to be SUPER
packed. [group=0003 type=0031 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] We've got venues to
schedule! Roadies to hire! NEW SONGS
TO WRITE! AAAAAAH! [group=0003 type=002f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_00_02_Center:
I don't know what I'd do without Pearl.

[color=0002]~Pearl Houzuki Appreciation Corner~[color=ffff]

When I felt lost and directionless after
[color=0003]deserting [color=ffff]from the Octarian army, it
was Pearl who showed me [color=0002]hope[color=ffff]. [group=0003 type=002d params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

The two of us formed Off the Hook,
and ever since, I've felt like I'm just
waiting to wake up [color=0002]from a dream[color=ffff]. [group=0003 type=002e params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

Sniff... Sorry—something's in my
eye... fjdlsjfkdask; [group=0003 type=0032 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_00_03_Center:
OK! I needed a good cry there. All
better now. [group=0003 type=0031 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] Now, I can't forget
about the [color=0003]biggest item on my to-do
list[color=ffff]. It's not world-tour business,
but it's every bit as important.

[color=0003]Project Memverse (name not final)[color=ffff]

That's what I'm currently calling my
project to help Agent 8 and all the
others [color=0003]Kamabo Co. [color=ffff]preyed on. Gotta
make it one of my top priorities!
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_01_00_Center:
We're busy, busy, busy prepping for
our [color=0003]world tour[color=ffff]! Seems like we never
run out of things to take care of. [group=0003 type=0031 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

There aren't many hills Pearl cares
enough to die on, but when it comes to
music, she gets real serious. [group=0003 type=002f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

I take our music seriously too, and
sometimes we both feel so strongly
about something that it turns into
a fight.

That part's never fun. [group=0003 type=0032 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] But when
it comes to our art, we have to be true
to ourselves! No compromises!
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_01_01_Center:
Oh, speaking of the tour, Pearl let me
know we're [color=0002]taking Agent 8 with us[color=ffff]!
[color=0003]Agent 8[color=ffff] seems psyched to join up. [group=0003 type=0035 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

If we're this busy now, wait until the
tour actually starts! We'll need all the
help we can get, [color=0002]so this is a big relief[color=ffff].
I know we can count on Agent 8. [group=0003 type=0033 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

Now I can put all my energy into making
new songs! THE POWEEERRR! [group=0003 type=0030 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_01_02_Center:
Project Memverse (?) Update!

I've finished the prototype of [color=0003]the
virtual world I'm tentatively calling
the Memverse[color=ffff]! All that's there for now
is a recreation of [color=0003]Inkopolis Square[color=ffff]. [group=0003 type=0031 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
(The idea is for it to be a temporary
storehouse for memories.)

I'm still struggling with the bigger job
of extracting data from [color=0003]Kamabo Co.'s
systems[color=ffff]. It's tougher than I thought...
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_02_00_Center:
The world-tour schedule is finalized,
[color=0002]and Pearl is in rare form[color=ffff]! She's seemed
even more driven since things started
to take shape. It's great to see! [group=0003 type=002e params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

I took the day off today to [color=0003]go for
a walk in Inkopolis Square[color=ffff].

I'm seeing more [color=0003]Octolings[color=ffff] like me
around than ever, which is exciting.
There's real progress in the [color=0003]Octoling
movement to make it to the surface[color=ffff].

I wonder if Agent 8 and I escaping had
any influence on that. [group=0003 type=0034 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] It's a nice
thought, at least! [group=0003 type=0033 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

Though of course, plenty of Octolings
are still stuck underground...
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_02_01_Center:
Oh, and on the subject of Octolings,
I finally cracked Kamabo Co.'s system!

The first thing I did was pull up all the
data on the [color=0003]Octolings[color=ffff], [color=0003]Octarians[color=ffff], and
anyone else Kamabo Co. got their
claws into.

Seems like Kamabo Co. operated the
[color=0003]Deepsea Metro [color=ffff]for a very long time.
They kept people under their control
through a process called
[color=0003]sanitization[color=ffff]. [group=0003 type=0036 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

It's possible that everyone I knew at
the [color=0003]training program [color=ffff]or [color=0003]my old job [color=ffff]has
been sanitized by now...

I want to help them! I WILL help them!
After all, that's the whole point of
Project Memverse (name pending)! [group=0003 type=002f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_03_00_Left:
Digging through Kamabo Co.'s system
finally yielded Commander Tartar's
[color=0003]top secret files[color=ffff]. I have a firmer grasp
of [color=0003]how sanitization works[color=ffff], so I'll lay
it all out here.

・ Sanitization extracts the subject's
　[color=0003]thoughts [color=ffff]and [color=0003]memories[color=ffff]. These are
　saved as [color=0003]mem cakes[color=ffff].

・ Post-sanitization, the structure
[color=0003]　[color=ffff]housing the subject's [color=0003]soul [color=ffff]is left as
　[color=0003]a hollow husk[color=ffff].

・ Injecting dummy information into that
[color=0003]　[color=ffff]husk enables [color=0003]total control of the
　original subject[color=ffff].
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_03_01_Center:
It confirms my theories, but I hate
being right about this. How awful! [group=0003 type=0036 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
Could sanitization have also caused
Agent 8's memory loss?

The good news is, there's [color=0002]hope[color=ffff]. [group=0003 type=002d params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

If we could return the [color=0003]mem cakes[color=ffff] to a
sanitized soul, it might reverse the
process and restore the subject's self.

This has really lit a fire under me. [group=0003 type=002f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
Project Memverse (title TK) is [color=0003]officially
launching[color=ffff]!

[color=0003]Cuttlefish[color=ffff] hinted at souls once or
twice, and it sounds like he wasn't
being metaphorical. He knows more
than I gave him credit for! [group=0003 type=0031 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_03_02_Center:
But it's not ALL research with me.
Off the Hook is going great too! [group=0003 type=0030 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

Everything is ready for the world tour,
including our songs, and we've been
killing it in rehearsals!

Poor Pearl doesn't know what to do with
a free moment anymore. I'm always
catching her [color=0002]bouncing with anticipation[color=ffff].

The sooner our tour kicks off, the
better! [group=0003 type=0033 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] There's so much good in
my life that my heart might burst!
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_04_00_Left:
This is hopeless. [group=0003 type=0032 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] I have no way
to determine who any of these mem
cakes belong to.

[group=0003 type=0034 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00][group=0003 type=0034 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00][group=0003 type=0034 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

I started off analyzing mem cakes
from Agent 8 and Cuttlefish. Then I
did a large-scale survey of mem cakes
I found in [color=0003]Kamabo Co.[color=ffff]'s warehouse.
(Or rather, its [color=0003]trash dump[color=ffff].)

But none of that helped me match the
mem cakes to their owners. [group=0003 type=0030 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

If it wasn't bad enough that [color=0003]their
origins are hard to trace[color=ffff], I can't rule
out that a single mem cake could be
made from multiple Octolings
[color=0003]mixed together[color=ffff].
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_04_01_Center:
So now what?

I'm not yet to the point where I could
return these mem cakes to their
owners even if I tried.

Would it have killed [color=0003]Commander Tartar[color=ffff]
to manage its data properly?! [group=0003 type=0036 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

Uggghhh. This is feeling like a dead end.
So it's time to change my approach!
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_04_02_Center:
In better news: Off the Hook's [color=0002]world
tour [color=ffff]is getting closer! [group=0003 type=0033 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

Eight is really shouldering a lot of the
last-minute load for us. It's been just
what I needed!

Oh, and about [color=0002]Eight[color=ffff]! I always kinda felt
like "Agent 8" was too formal to say
all the time. [group=0003 type=0031 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

So the other day, I took the plunge and
called out, "Hey, [color=0002]Eight[color=ffff]!" And I got [color=0002]the
widest smile[color=ffff] in return! [group=0003 type=0035 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

[size=150%]MISSION: SUCCESS! [group=0003 type=002d params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00][size=100%]
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_05_00_Center:
New idea: if I can't get the system to
match a mem cake to its soul, what if I
could get the mem cake itself to do
the work?

[color=0003]All that the thoughts and memories
would have to do is return to their
natural form.[color=ffff]

Now, THAT'S an idea worth exploring!
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_05_01_Left:
So, in practical terms...

By taking the thoughts and memories
stored in mem cakes and [color=0003]mixing [color=ffff]them
up further, then setting them up with
the basic framework of a soul, in
theory they could [color=0003]sift through them
and select [color=ffff]the ones where they belong.

I don't see a way to do all that in the
real world. But if I convert the mem
cakes into data that I could upload to
a [color=0003]virtual space[color=ffff]...
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_05_02_Center:
This is sounding more and more doable!
[color=0003]Project Memverse (name may change)[color=ffff]
[group=0003 type=002f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] IS BACK ON! [group=0003 type=002f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

I never thought I'd see the day when
the Memverse virtual world I created
would serve an actual purpose!

Though I haven't really touched it since
finishing the prototype. I hope it'll do
what I need it to. [group=0003 type=0031 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_06_00_Left:
Memverse Development Notes

-Secure required processing power by
tapping into Kamabo Co.'s mainframe.
Use the Memverse prototype virtual
world to gather mem-cake data for
later world expansion.

-Access confirmed from within the
Kamabo Co. internal network. Set up
external access via standard sea-
cucumber phone.
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_06_01_Left:
-Users set color chips (from general
memory index) into a Palette (basic
copy of their soul) and establish a
connection with compatible memories.

-Adversity proven effective for memory
retention. Have users repeat tasks
to make the memories stick. Once the
memories are sufficiently locked in,
complete the processing. All proposed
steps so far have been verified down
the line.

-Might be good to represent these
steps as climbing a tower?
1 task = 1 floor
Top floor = Processing complete
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_06_02_Left:
-If user reaches the top floor,
the experiment is a success. User's
soul is restored to its original state,
with its own thoughts and memories.

-Create dedicated avatars with special
roles to ensure smooth operation.
Need avatars for:
・ Memverse management
・ User guidance
・ System security
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_07_00_Center:
I've finalized my Memverse concept and
started working on it in earnest. [group=0003 type=0035 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
I'll need to put in some [color=0003]operators[color=ffff]
pretty soon.

I'll handle [color=0003]system management [color=ffff]myself!
And I think [color=0003]user guidance[color=ffff] would be a
great fit for [color=0002]Pearl[color=ffff].

It's really, truly all starting to
come together!

I'll put myself at the top of the
[color=0003]tower[color=ffff], so Pearl has to climb it [color=0002]to
get the user to me[color=ffff]. [group=0003 type=002e params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_07_01_Center:
Wait...would that make me like
[color=0002]a storybook princess? [color=ffff][group=0003 type=0034 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

[color=0002]Hahaha, now I HAVE to do it![color=ffff]

I'll build you a tower worth the climb,
brave [color=0002]Pearl[color=ffff]!

All that experience making training
stages from my days as a tutor at
the [color=0003]training program [color=ffff]is about to
pay off! [group=0003 type=002f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

After all, I want this tower to be a
good experience for the [color=0003]users[color=ffff]. [group=0003 type=0035 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_07_02_Center:
But I still need someone to handle
[color=0003]system security[color=ffff] for the Memverse.
Maybe I can ask [color=0003]that person Cuttlefish
introduced me to[color=ffff] for help there.

And I'm hoping [color=0002]Eight[color=ffff] will volunteer to
be [color=0003]the first test subject[color=ffff].

I better not forget about the
Off the Hook world tour! It's [color=0002]two
short months away[color=ffff] now.

[group=0003 type=002f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]I'll make time for music
AND the Memverse![group=0003 type=002f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_08_00_Center:
Our world tour has started!
It's a lot of work, but a lot of fun too.
I love being in Off the Hook so much!
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_09_00_Center:
[size=150%]GAAAAAAHHHHHH![size=100%]
WHY did I think I'd have time for a
major project WHILE ON TOUR?!

I'm writing this way past midnight.
This is me venting without screaming
so loud it wakes everyone up.

I had an idea right before bed. [group=0003 type=002d params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]
I wanted to get it down before I forgot,
so I went to my computer. And the next
thing I knew, hours had gone by... [group=0003 type=0032 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

What am I doing?! [color=0002]Pearl [color=ffff]and the [color=0002]tour[color=ffff]
[color=0002]staff[color=ffff] are relying on me. I can't tell
them, "Sorry—no show today; I forgot
to sleep."
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_09_01_Center:
Well, we're [color=0003]taking a break[color=ffff] once the
first half of the tour is over, so maybe
I can buckle down and finish this then.

In fact, no maybes about it! This
[color=0003]Octoling [color=ffff]can do anything! [group=0003 type=002f params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

But for now, Project Memverse (final
title pending) is [color=0003]on the back burner[color=ffff].


You know...

I might not have time to do the whole
thing by myself during the tour break.

But that's what friends are for! I know
plenty of [color=0003]engineers from the old days[color=ffff]
who'd jump at the chance to help. [group=0003 type=0033 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]


I hope so, anyway...


Oops, I think I see the first rays of
dawn out there. [group=0003 type=0031 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00] I've REALLY got
to get some sleep.

Goodnight!
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_10_00_Center:
[group=0003 type=002d params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]IT'S! ALL! FINISHED![group=0003 type=002d params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

Project Memverse, which I've given
the final title of...
[color=0002]★Dramatic Days in Orderland★[color=ffff]
...is ready to launch! [group=0003 type=0030 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00][group=0003 type=0035 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

Off the Hook's world tour is on its
midway break, so I've been putting all
my energy into development.

With so much time on my hands,
I might've gotten carried away.
I [color=0003]maybe took it a bit too far[color=ffff]... [group=0003 type=0031 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

But everything's looking good for me to
help Eight and all the other victims of
Kamabo Co. [color=0003]get their memories back[color=ffff].

I need to let Pearl and everyone know
the good news right away!
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_10_01_Left:
One last note so I don't forget:

As I was messing around to make
[color=0003]sea-cucumber phones[color=ffff] a viable access
terminal, I found a [color=0003]security hole[color=ffff].

In theory, someone could exploit it and
pull anyone with a sea-cucumber phone
[color=0003]into the Memverse against their will[color=ffff].

I need to remember to warn the phone
company about this.
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_11_00_Center:
Tomorrow is finally the trial launch of
[color=0002]Dramatic Days in Orderland![color=ffff]

[color=0002]Eight [color=ffff]will be our first test subject.

We've put the system through its
paces, but we can't guarantee there
aren't any [color=0003]unknown risks[color=ffff]. But [color=0002]Eight's
more than happy [color=ffff]to help out anyway.
This means so much to me! [group=0003 type=0035 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

Eight being Eight, I'm sure getting to
the top of my tower will be like playing
on Easy Mode.

I really hope Eight's memories return...
Fingers crossed!
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_11_01_Center:
Pearl is joining us too. She doesn't
seem to get what it's all about, but
she's usually down for whatever.
Together, the two of us will [color=0002]make
sure Eight gets through it safe[color=ffff]! [group=0003 type=0033 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

Eight is just the beginning. If this goes
well, soon all of Kamabo Co.'s victims
can get their selves back—and [color=0002]have
fun while they do it[color=ffff]! [group=0003 type=0035 params=00 00 80 3f 00 00 00 00]

I'm so excited that I have no idea how
I'll sleep between now and tomorrow!
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_12_00_Left:
From: Acht

Hey, Marina. I found these old photos.
Thought you'd get a kick out of them.

You were so talented and hardworking
in those days.

Me, I was always slacking off and
cutting class. I got to know the inside
of the instructor's office pretty well.

Every lecture was the same. "You
should be diligent and dedicated, like
a true Octarian!" I heard it so many
times that it turned into white noise.

I wonder how she's doing now.
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_13_00_Left:
From: Acht

Hey, Marina. Think this is the only
photo of the two of us together.

You were recruited for an elite position
in an Octavio unit after this was taken,
right? Think I remember hearing that.

I ended up handling security behind
the scenes. Could've been worse.
Going to the front lines was too much
like work.

Guess I never returned the records
I borrowed from you. But then, you've
still got the ones I lent you, so it all
balances out.

Looking at this, I still remember
wondering if you weren't going to get
in trouble, hanging out with a slacker
like me.

So imagine my surprise to find out
you'd been cooking up some sick tracks.
Turned out even an elite knew her way
around some decks.
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_14_00_Left:
From: Acht

Hey, Marina. You can guess the chaos
your desertion caused. I ended up
without much to do except make music.

You remember that club way down in
the lowest levels of the base? I DJed
there for a long time, since I knew it
was one place where the brass wouldn't
be caught dead.

As time went on, I got more and more
into it, to the point where music was
all I thought about.

Honestly...that whole period of my life
is kind of a haze.
LayoutMsg/Sdodr_DevelopLog_00.DevelopLog_Message_14_01_Left:
But thanks to getting sucked into the
world of order, I caught up with you
again. So maybe it wasn't such a
bad thing.

After all, I found my way to the
surface. I'm back to making my kind
of music. Here we go again, right?

If you're ever up for it, we should jam.

P.S. Consider me an Off the Hook fan.
I found a record I think Pearl would like,
so I'll send it over later. Give my best
to Eight.

delete existing job scenarios to add new ones.

You can save up to 50 job scenarios. Now that
you have reached that number, you'll need to
delete existing job scenarios to add new ones.
